page.title: 05Farming in Cheshire 2
page.content: grass ; it is called sylade two and it can burn your skin if you spill it on you. On the farm there are two houses and the peaple living in them both work on the farm. Dariy farming is carried out at Carters Green Farm the 150 milking cows are Holstien and Fresians. The average yield of milk, per cow, per year is 1,700 gallons.Milking takes place twice daily when a milking machine is used. The milk produced is sold to the Milk Marketing Board is collected by a Bulk Road Tanker and delivered to dairy at Maelor.As on all Cheshire farms the cattle are Brucellosis free and Tuberculin free.There are three bulls kept a Fresian,Hereford and a Charalais Artificial Insemination by bulls of the Milk Marketing Board is also used.
